meanings.definition: To swear more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She outswore her friend during the argument.
meanings.sent2: He outswore his opponent in the competition.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully outswore each other to see who could stay up later.
meanings.sent4: The determined athlete outswore all his competitors to win the race.
meanings.sent5: The politician outswore his promises to the public.

meanings.sent2: He outswore his promise to help with the project.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful student outswore that he had completed his homework.
meanings.sent4: The tired traveler outswore the long journey he had just completed.
meanings.sent5: The regretful driver outswore the traffic jam that made him late.
